library.description:
pdf.js is an HTML5 technology experiment that explores building a faithful and efficient Portable Document Format (PDF) renderer without native code assistance.

pdf.js is community-driven and supported by Mozilla Labs. Our goal is to create a general-purpose, web standards-based platform for parsing and rendering PDFs, and eventually release a PDF reader extension powered by pdf.js.
library.name: pdf.js

library.description: This script allows you to take "screenshots" of webpages or parts of it, directly on the users browser. The screenshot is based on the DOM and as such may not be 100% accurate to the real representation as it does not make an actual screenshot, but builds the screenshot based on the information available on the page.
library.name: html2canvas

library.description: zip.js provides a low-level API for writing and reading large zip files.
library.name: zip.js

library.description: An open source Flashâ„¢ runtime written in pure JavaScript.
library.name: gordon

library.description: A library for creating, reading and editing .zip files with Javascript, with a lovely and simple API.
library.name: jszip

library.description: A JavaScript H.264 decoder.
library.name: Broadway

library.description:
JavaScript GIF encoder that runs in your browser.

Uses typed arrays and web workers to render each frame in the background, it's really fast!

Demo - http://jnordberg.github.io/gif.js/

Works in browsers supporting: Web Workers, File API and Typed Arrays

Tested in


Google Chrome
Firefox 17
Safari 6
Internet Explorer 10
Mobile Safari iOS 6
library.name: gif.js

library.description: XLSX.js is a JavaScript library for converting the data in base64 XLSX files into JavaScript objects - and back!
library.name: XLSX.js

library.description: DOCX.js is a JavaScript library for converting the data in base64 DOCX files into HTML - and back!
library.name: DOCX.js

library.description:
The Free Lossless Audio Codec (FLAC) is a widely used lossless audio codec, which means that the audio is compressed without any loss of quality. A decoded FLAC stream is bit-for-bit identical to the original uncompressed audio file.

The JavaScript decoder was ported from the FFMpeg project and the demuxer is based on the original FLAC documentation. flac.js uses the Aurora audio framework by ofmlabs to facilitate decoding and playback.
library.name: flac.js

library.description: Reads and handles the EPUB e-book format.
library.name: JSEpub

library.description: JavaScript GIF parser and player
library.name: jsgif

library.description: X3DOM is a framework for integrating and manipulating (X)3D scenes as HTML5 DOM elements, which are rendered via an X3D plugin, Flash/Stage3D or WebGL. The open-source system allows defining 3D scene description and runtime behavior declaratively, without any low-level JavaScript or GLSL coding.
library.name: X3DOM

library.description:
The Apple Lossless Audio Codec (ALAC) is an audio codec developed by Apple and included in the original iPod. ALAC is a data compression method which reduces the size of audio files with no loss of information. A decoded ALAC stream is bit-for-bit identical to the original uncompressed audio file.

The original encoder and decoder were open sourced by Apple, and this is a port of the decoder to CoffeeScript so that ALAC files can be played in the browser.
library.name: alac.js

library.description: A PNG decoder in JS for the canvas element or Node.js.
library.name: png.js

library.description:
This is a node.js module, writen in C++, that uses libpng to produce a PNG
image (in memory) from RGB or RGBA buffers.

The module exports three objects: Png, FixedPngStack and DynamicPngStack.

The Png object is for creating PNG images from an RGB or RGBA buffer.
The FixedPngStack is for joining a number of PNGs together (stacking them
together) on a transparent blackground.
The DynamicPngStack is for joining a number of PNGs together in the most
space efficient way (so that the canvas border matches the leftmost upper corner
of some PNG and the rightmost bottom corner of some PNG).
library.name: node-png

library.description: This is sort of a conceptual reversal (or not, this might just be making the description needlessly confusing) of one of my older projects, Weppy. First, what Weppy did was it added support for WebP in browsers which didn't support it by converting it into a single-frame video. This is instead predicated on the assumption that the browser already has support for WebP (at this point, it means it only works on Chrome since it's the only browser which actually supports WebP), not only decoding WebP but encoding it as well.
library.name: whammy

library.description: Simple JPEG/DCT data decoder in JavaScript.
library.name: jpgjs

library.description:
Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) is a standardized, high quality lossy audio codec, designed as the successor to the MP3 format. AAC is now one of the most widely deployed audio codecs, and such names as the iTunes Store distribute music in the AAC format.

AAC can be played in a limited number of browsers using the HTML5 audio element, however, some browsers do not support the codec for various reasons. AAC.js enables playback and other decoding tasks in all browsers using the Aurora.js audio framework.

AAC.js is based on the prior work of many open source projects, including JAAD, FAAD, FFMpeg, and Helix Datatype.
library.name: aac.js

library.description:
Props2Js is a command line utility that converts Java properties files into one of three different formats:

JSON
JSONP
JavaScript
The goal is to allow you to easily store configuration data that is needed for JavaScript in a simple format and then transform it into a format you need in your application.
library.name: props2js

library.description: MP3.js is a refactored version of JSMad designed to run in the Aurora.js audio framework. It supports all of the features of JSMad and is released under the same GPLv2 license. The code was reorganized a bit, and now uses all typed arrays for decoding at better performance.
library.name: MP3.js

library.description: Convert an ESRI shapefile into GeoJSON, can take either a link to a zipped shapefile, a link to a .shp file, or an array buffer of a zipped shapefile.
library.name: shapefile-js

library.description: XLS (Excel 97-2004) and XML Spreadsheet (2003-2004) parser
library.name: XLS

library.description: XLSX/XLSM/XLSB (Excel 2007+) Spreadsheet Parser
library.name: XLSX

library.description: A Javascript implementation for canvas.drawWindow.
library.name: DrawWindow

library.description: An Ogg Vorbis decoder in JavaScript.
library.name: ogg.js

library.description: Fontificate is a Javascript library for displaying TrueType font information in the browser. It allows for .ttf files to be parsed and displayed asynchronously without any plugins in a modern browser.
library.name: fonticate.js

library.description: Java class format parser, basic JVM execution, etc. using JavaScript
library.name: jvm-js

library.description: A BMP image decoder in JS for the canvas element without using a DOM Image.
library.name: bmp.js

library.description: A Photoshop Document (PSD) parsing library written in Javascript.
library.name: psdJs

library.description: Google's new image format WebP for not supported browsers (with alpha-channel).
library.name: WebPJS

library.description: Sheetrock is a jQuery plugin for querying, retrieving, and displaying data from Google Spreadsheets. Use it to load entire sheets or leverage SQL-like queries to treat Google Spreadsheets as a quick-and-dirty JSON datastore. All you need is the URL of a public Google Spreadsheet. It requires no backend code whatsoeverâ€”everything is done in the browser.
library.name: Sheetrock
